required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SIMBRINZA® Suspension BID as an Adjunctive to Prostaglandin Analogue (PGA)
clinical_study.official_title: Additive Effect of Twice Daily Brinzolamide 1%/Brimonidine 0.2% Fixed Dose Combination as an Adjunctive Therapy to a Prostaglandin Analogue

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the additive intraocular pressure (IOP) lowering effect of brinzolamide 1%/brimonidine 0.2% (dosed twice per day (BID)) when added to a prostaglandin analogue (PGA) in subjects with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

detailed_description.textblock: This study consisted of 2 sequential phases: Screening/Eligibility Phase, followed by a Masked Treatment Phase (Phase II). Subjects were assigned into one of 3 PGA therapy groups for the duration of the study, based upon commercial availability.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline (on PGA) in Diurnal IOP (Mean of 09:00 and 11:00 Time Points) at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry and averaged over the 09:00 AM and 11:00 AM time points. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry and averaged over the 09:00 AM and 11:00 AM time points. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in Diurnal IOP at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry and averaged over the 09:00 AM and 11:00 AM time points. A more negative percent change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in IOP at 11:00 at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry at 11:00 AM. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in IOP at 11:00 at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry at 11:00 AM. A more negative percent change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in IOP at 09:00 at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry at 09:00 AM. Baseline is defined as the average of the 9:00 hour values at both Eligibility visits. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percentage Change From Baseline at 09:00 at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry at 9:00 AM. Baseline is defined as the average of the 9:00 hour values at both Eligibility visits.A more negative percent change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

arm_group.description: Brinzolamide 1%/brimonidine 0.2% tartrate ophthalmic suspension, 1 drop instilled 2 times per day in affected eye(s) (09:00 and 21:00) plus designated prostaglandin analogue, 1 drop instilled in each eye once per day in the evening for 42 days
Brinz/brim vehicle, 1 drop instilled 2 times per day in affected eye(s) (09:00 and 21:00) plus designated prostaglandin analogue, 1 drop instilled in each eye once per day in the evening for 42 days

intervention.description: Inactive ingredients used as a placebo for masking purposes

intervention.other_name: TRAVATAN® PQ (Travoprost ophthalmic solution with PQ, 0.004%)

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

link.description: Results from the Novartis Clinical Trial Results Website

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 37 sites located in Argentina (3), Australia (4), Canada (12), Chile (3), France (1), Germany (3), Greece (2), Israel (3), Spain (3), and United Kingdom (3).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 290 subjects enrolled in the study, 102 were exited during the Screening/Eligibility period. This reporting group includes all randomized subjects. One randomized subject did not receive investigational product and is excluded from the Full Analysis Set and the Safety Analysis Set.

group.title: SIMBRINZA + PGA
group.description: Brinzolamide 1%/brimonidine 0.2% tartrate ophthalmic suspension, 1 drop instilled 2 times per day in affected eye(s) (09:00 and 21:00) plus designated prostaglandin analogue, 1 drop instilled in each eye once per day in the evening for 42 days

group.title: Vehicle + PGA
group.description: Brinz/brim vehicle, 1 drop instilled 2 times per day in affected eye(s) (09:00 and 21:00) plus designated prostaglandin analogue, 1 drop instilled in each eye once per day in the evening for 42 days

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all randomized subjects who received a dose of study medication and had at least 1 of the 2 scheduled on-treatment visits [Full Analysis Set (FAS)].

group.title: SIMBRINZA + PGA
group.description: Brinzolamide 1%/brimonidine 0.2% tartrate ophthalmic suspension, 1 drop instilled 2 times per day in affected eye(s) (09:00 and 21:00) plus designated prostaglandin analogue, 1 drop instilled in each eye once per day in the evening for 42 days

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Baseline Diurnal IOP
measure.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry and averaged over the 09:00 AM and 11:00 AM time points. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage).

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline (on PGA) in Diurnal IOP (Mean of 09:00 and 11:00 Time Points) at Week 6
outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry and averaged over the 09:00 AM and 11:00 AM time points. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: FAS. Only subjects with a value at both baseline and time point are included in the calculation of change.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline through study completion, an average of 6 weeks.
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events (AEs) were obtained through solicited and spontaneous comments from subjects and through observations by the Investigator as outlined in the study protocol.This analysis population includes all subjects who received a dose of study medication (Safety Analysis Set).

group.title: SIMBRINZA + PGA

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Brand Medical Director Ophtha, GMA Ophthalmics
